Package nom.tam.util.type

Class ElementType<B extends Buffer>

  • java.lang.Object
    • nom.tam.util.type.ElementType<B>
  • Type Parameters:
    B - the generic type of data buffer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PrimitiveType
    public abstract class ElementType<B extends Buffer>
extends Object
    A base data element type in a FITS image or table column, with associated functions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ElementType

        protected ElementType​(int size,
                      boolean varSize,
                      Class<?> primitiveClass,
                      Class<?> wrapperClass,
                      Class<B> bufferClass,
                      char type,
                      int bitPix)
        Instantiates a new FITS data element type.
        Parameters:
        size - the number of bytes in the FITS representation of that type.
        varSize - true if the element has a size that varies from object to object.
        primitiveClass - The primitive data type, e.g. `int.class`, or null if no primitive type is associated.
        wrapperClass - The boxed data type, e.g. `Integer.class`, or null if no boxed type is associated.
        bufferClass - The type of underlying buffer (in FITS), or null if arrays of this type cannot be wrapped into a buffer directly (e.g. because of differing byrte size or order).
        type - The second character of the Java array type, e.g. `J` from `[J` for `long[]`.
        bitPix - The BITPIX header value for an image HDU of this type.

        public void appendBuffer​(B buffer,

        Appends data from one buffer to another.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the destination buffer
        dataToAppend - the buffer containing the data segment to append.

        dataToAppend - the buffer containing the data segment to append.

      • individualSize

        @Deprecated
public final boolean individualSize()
        Deprecated.
        Use isVariableSize() instead.
        Returns:
        true if this type of element comes in all sizes, and the particular size of an obejct of this element type is specific to its instance. Or, false for fixed-sized elements.

      • size

        public int size​(Object instance)
        currently the only individual size primitive so, keep it simple
        Parameters:
        instance - the object to calculate the size
        Returns:
        the size in bytes of the object instance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the object is not of the type expected by this class.
